td.div: Please check back for updates and information.
Below are three websites that will be helpful for you in gathering up-to-date information regarding the Novel Coronavirus

div.strong: Talking to Children About COVID-19 (Coronavirus): A Parent Resource

td.div: We are also in contact with the New Jersey Department of Education (NJDOE). NJDOE recommends that schools increase education on respiratory hygiene. We are focusing on training teachers and students to follow the steps listed below to prevent the transmission of respiratory infections. We ask that you assist by reinforcing these guidelines in your home as well:

ol.li: Cover your coughs and sneezes with a tissue or cough into your sleeve, not your hands.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth.
Wash hands often for at least 20 seconds, especially after coughing or sneezing.
Use alcohol-based hand sanitizer if soap and water are not available.
Stay home from class and work if you’re sick.
Get a flu shot - it's not too late to be protected.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched surfaces and objects.
